titles.title: A resolution expressing serious concern about widespread irregularities in Bolivia's October 20, 2019, general elections and supporting the convening of new elections in Bolivia at the earliest possible date.

A resolution expressing serious concern about widespread irregularities in Bolivia's October 20, 2019, general elections and supporting the convening of new elections in Bolivia at the earliest possible date.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

calendar.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Ordered to be reported with an amendment in the nature of a substitute favorably.

action.text: Committee on Foreign Relations. Reported by Senator Risch with an amendment in the nature of a substitute and with an amended preamble. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 341.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate with an amendment and an amended preamble by Unanimous Consent.

term.name: Rule of law and government transparency
Sovereignty, recognition, national governance and status

bill.summary: This resolution expresses the Senate's concern over irregularities in the 2019 general elections in Bolivia, supports the expeditious convening of new democratic elections that are free, fair, and transparent, and urges all Bolivians to repudiate violence and peacefully exercise their rights.
